availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Skaggs (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas M. Skaggs and Patience Skaggs. Married to Elizabeth Ellison Skaggs in Green County, Kentucky, on October 30, 1854. Father of Winfield P. Skaggs, Mary S. Skaggs, John W.J. Skaggs, Thomas W. Skaggs, and Sarah E. Skaggs. Farmer in Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 27A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 561.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Gradyville Precinct, p. 71B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027, Adair County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 000594378.
